newsitem.title: USA: Baldwin Piano cuts 78 jobs, sees savings.
newsitem.headline: Baldwin Piano cuts 78 jobs, sees savings.

text.p: Baldwin Piano & Organ Co said Tuesday it had cut 78 manufacturing jobs at its plants in Conway and Trumann Ark., Greenwood, Miss., and Juarez, Mexico, representing a reduction of nearly eight percent of the workforce at the four plants.
The company said the cuts should bring 1997 savings of about $1 million dollars, net of severance costs, with even greater savings in future years.
Nearly all the eliminated jobs were hourly jobs, and no special charges are anticipated, the company said.
"We are making tremendous strides in streamlining our manufacturing processes, and the implementation of synchronous manufacturing is a key element of this initiative," the company said.
